definition: to focus/to concentrate/to give one's full attention
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
variant of 專|专[zhuan1]
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
to register/to annotate/note/comment
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused

sentences.english: Put exertion instead into your own business and life.
sentences.chinese: 努力专注于你自己的事业和生活。

sentences.english: Since founded more than 20 years ago, we put all our efforts on produce high quality multi-functional tools.
sentences.chinese: 本公司建厂二十多年来不断专注于开拓高质量的产品。

sentences.english: Jet Li has decided to quit acting for a year to focus on disaster relief and reconstruction of quake-hit areas.
sentences.chinese: 李连杰决定息影一年，专注赈灾及灾区重建工作。

sentences.english: He is goal-oriented and driven by results.
sentences.chinese: 他专注目标，并受成果驱使。

sentences.english: We really, really focused on Chinese search.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有想那么多，只是专注于开发中文搜索。

sentences.english: Despite his obvious desire to focus on singing, Lin is set to also work on dancing.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他很想专注于唱歌方面，他也很努力的练跳舞。

sentences.english: Not even the most dedicated person is immune to the temptation of occasional chitchat.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最专注的人也禁不起偶尔聊天的诱惑。

sentences.english: President Obama will get down to business soon after his arrival in Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统一经抵达莫斯科后将会专注于正事。

sentences.english: Stagnation and fatigue are other factors that can negatively affect concentration.
sentences.chinese: 停滞和疲惫是影响你专注力的另外的因素。

sentences.english: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest.
sentences.chinese: 在最黑暗的日子，我找到希望，然后专注于光明。

sentences.english: The NMR concentrates on quickly switching messages between components.
sentences.chinese: NMR专注于在组件间快速交换消息。

sentences.english: Concentrate your efforts on smaller and smaller areas .
sentences.chinese: 把你的专注集中在越来越小的领域。

sentences.english: Focusing with perfect discipline on the polestar yields insight about their movements.
sentences.chinese: 对于北极星的专注可以获得对于其运动的洞察。

sentences.english: It is a lesson that human architecture will have to learn, or re-learn — with far-reaching implications.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大一直专注于将这些经验转换利用到建筑上。

sentences.english: Anecdotal accounts suggest that effortful learning may also help some patients.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些消息指出，专注学习或许也能帮助一些病患。

definition: to concentrate/absorption/concentration/engrossed
with single-hearted devotion (idiom)
unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
deep plowing and careful cultivation
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
motive/intention/to be diligent or attentive/careful
to be strongly attached to/to be dedicated/to cling to
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
to focus
to concentrate fully on sth/single-minded
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to study meticulously/to delve into
to love ardently/to adore
